user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_str_equal_caseless_n_:
```c
int
MHD_str_equal_caseless_n_ (const char *const str1,
                           const char *const str2,
                           size_t maxlen)
{
  size_t i;

  for (i = 0; i < maxlen; ++i)
  {
    const char c1 = str1[i];
    const char c2 = str2[i];
    if (0 == c2)
      return 0 == c1;
    if (charsequalcaseless (c1, c2))
      continue;
    else
      return 0;
  }
  return ! 0;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
return ! 0;
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation. The statement "return ! 0;" is reachable when the for-loop completes all iterations (i == maxlen) without encountering a null terminator in str2 and without any mismatches — in that case control falls through to that return, which yields 1 (true).
